page.title: 15Hinwick House
page.content: The house was begun in l706 and completed by l710. It cost Â£3,848. It was built of local stone dug out of the cellars and from the local stone pit. The oak timber used came from local plantations. During the First World War the house was used as a convalescent home. Today it stands as an example of Queen Anne architecture and is still lived in by the Orlebar family. Tours of the house can be made by arrangement and meals can also be arranged. At the house there is an exhibition of fashion and objets d'arts dating from the early l8th century to the l950's. There are also some fine examples of local lace on display.
